FuncDef: The hwtacacs-server timer response-timeout command sets the response timeout interval of an HWTACACS server. The undo hwtacacs-server timer response-timeout command restores the default response timeout interval of an HWTACACS server. By default, the response timeout interval for an HWTACACS server is 5 seconds.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the response timeout interval of an HWTACACS server.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 300, in seconds. Default:5

ExtraInfo: After the device sends a request packet to the HWTACACS server, if the device does not receive any response packet from the server within the specified response timeout interval:- If only one HWTACACS server is configured, the device does not retransmit the request to this server.- If both active/standby HWTACACS servers are available and the TCP link between them works normally, the device retransmits the request to the standby server after timeout. If the TCP link is broken during the timeout interval, the device immediately retransmits the request to the standby server.This improves reliability of HWTACACS authentication, authorization, and accounting.The default value is recommended.
